activities.loc: Law Enforcement Center - Lower Level Hearing Room - LC300

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael L Herrington Jr

records.addlTxt: of Intent to Introduce Defendant's Statements, by the State.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim A.J.H and the mother A.N.H (person, property, residence or family). No contact with any minor children.

1:32 PM Defendant Michael L Herrington Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez appeared by video for Michael L Herrington Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Initial appearance on October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
